World.title: Will Trump’s ‘imperfect plan’ for ending the Ukraine war work?
World.description: Some European leaders feel sidelined as US mediation takes Russian priorities into consideration.

World.title: Russia criticises European moves to amend US plan to end Ukraine war

World.title: Barcelona see off Villarreal with goals from Raphinha and Yamal
World.description: Barca punish 10-man hosts Villarreal to win eighth consecutive La Liga game and move four points clear at the summit.

World.title: Israeli arms companies’ revenues soared in 2024
World.description: Israel's defence exports increased 13 percent in 2024 compared with the previous year to a record of almost $15bn.

World.title: US seizes second oil tanker off Venezuela's coast
World.description: The move comes after US President Donald Trump ordered a "blockade" of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

World.title: Gunmen kill nine in South Africa tavern attack
World.description: A further 10 people were injured in Bekkersdal after the perpetrators opened fire and "continued to shoot randomly".

World.title: Cartagena's iconic horse carriages give way to electric buggies
World.description: Cartagena, Colombia, is set to ban its iconic horse-drawn carriages, replacing them with electric buggies — a move dividing the historic city over tradition, tourism, and animal welfare.

World.title: Mo Salah focused on Egypt success at AFCON with Liverpool crisis behind him
World.description: Liverpool and Egypt star forward Mohamed Salah is centred on winning his first Africa Cup of Nations title.

World.title: Israel approves 19 new settlements in occupied West Bank
World.description: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move was about blocking the establishment of a Palestinian state.

World.description: As Gaza’s displaced Palestinians suffer from winter storms, UNICEF explains the basic needs essential to save children.

World.title: Epstein files: Whose names and photos are in the latest document drop?

World.title: Can Alliance of Sahel States find a way to curb advance of armed groups?
World.description: Leaders from Mali, Niger and Burkina Faso are hoping to find a way to repel advancing fighters linked to al-Qaeda.

World.title: Week in Pictures: From shooting in Australia to protest in Brussels

World.title: Israel kills two Palestinians, including 16 year-old, in West Bank
World.description: Israeli forces kill two Palestinians in the occupied West Bank amid continued violence against Palestinians.

World.title: Manhunt under way in South Africa after mass shooting in Johannesburg
World.description: South African police have launched a manhunt in search of the suspects that carried out a mass shooting in Johannesburg.

World.description: A week after a deadly mass shooting, Australia marks an official day of reflection to honor the 15 people killed by gunmen.

World.title: Palestinians attending wedding killed in Israeli attack on Gaza school
World.description: Six Palestinians have been killed in an attack by Israeli forces on a school sheltering displaced civilians in Gaza.

World.title: Palestinian family left homeless after house collapses in storm-hit Gaza

World.title: Rights groups condemn new record number of executions in Saudi Arabia
World.description: At least 347 people have now been put to death this year, according to the UK-based campaign group Reprieve.

World.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was booed as he arrived at the memorial event.

World.title: Russia-Ukraine war may “grind on for another 12 to 18 months”
World.description: “These peace negotiations are a farce.”

World.title: Thousands of candidates sit for government exam on airstrip in India
World.description: More than 8,000 candidates sat for a government exam on a runway in Odisha in India.

World.title: Algeria bill seeks to criminalise French colonial rule: What to know

World.title: 9 killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting
World.description: Authorities report that nine people have died and at least 10 others are injured after a shooting at a South African pub. The incident occurred early Sunday in Bekkersdal, west of Johannesburg.

World.title: Israel’s yellow line in Gaza has become a “site of killing”

World.description: One Palestinian killed by Israeli army in Gaza while two Palestinians, including a child, are shot dead in West Bank.

World.title: Australia beat England to win third Test and retain Ashes
World.description: Australia win Adelaide Test against England and forge an unassailable 3-0 lead in cricket's longest running series.

World.title: Sixty years ago, the world tried to stop racial discrimination and failed

World.title: US seizes second oil tanker off Venezuela

World.title: Russia says talks on US peace plan for Ukraine 'are proceeding constructively'

World.title: Imran Khan and wife given further jail terms after state gift fraud case

World.title: Survivors 'nervous and sceptical' about release of remaining Epstein files
World.description: US lawmakers who pushed for the documents to be made public have criticised the initial release as incomplete.

World.title: How Israel's grassroots hostage families group became a powerful international force

World.title: Comedian Bowen Yang announces Saturday Night Live exit

World.title: Neither Russia nor France: One West African country walks a diplomatic tightrope

World.title: Why British Jews are experiencing their biggest change in 60 years

Politics.title: Trail hunting to be banned as part of new animal welfare strategy

Politics.title: No evidence Reform broke electoral law, watchdog says

Politics.title: Politics chat: Redacted Epstein files released; Trump under pressure about economy
Politics.description: Extensive redactions of the Epstein files add to the political pressure President Trump is already under for his handling of the economy.

Politics.title: 'Congress is in a coma.' Former lawmakers sound alarm on health of the House

Politics.description: With months-long consulate and embassy delays being reported, the two tech companies say staying put in the U.S. right now could prevent workers from getting stranded in their home countries.

Business.title: Charity welcomes living wage rise in January
Business.description: The new rate will come into effect at the beginning of January, Caritas Jersey says.

Business.title: Cricket-themed bar chain Sixes goes into administration
Business.description: The chain, which is backed in part by England captain Ben Stokes, is remaining open for business except at one venue.

Business.title: Postcode glitch freezes pensioners out of winter heating benefit
Business.description: Customers living in a specific Glasgow postcode were unable to apply for the Warm Home Discount.

Business.title: Takeaway owner delivers 1,000 gifts to children

Business.title: The 'winners and losers' in Universal UK's plan to rival Disneyland Paris
Business.description: Within its first 20 years, Universal is expecting more annual visitors than any park gets in Europe.

Culture.title: "Arctic Alchemy" explores the wonder of the Alaskan wilderness
